00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the Tuple instructions.

00018 #include <machine.hpp>
00019 #include <instructions.hpp>
00020 
00021 namespace {
00022     inline int compareVectors(Tuple const & a, Tuple const & b){
00023         Size size = a.size() > b.size() ? a.size() : b.size();
00024         for(Index i = 0; i < size; i++){
00025             Number a_element = i < a.size() ? a[i].asNumber() : 0;
00026             Number b_element = i < b.size() ? b[i].asNumber() : 0;
00027             if      (a_element < b_element) return -1;
00028             else if (a_element > b_element) return  1;
00029         }
00030         return 0;
00031     }
00032     int compareVectors(Machine & machine){
00033         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00034         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00035         return compareVectors(a,b);
00036     }
00037 }
00038 
00039 namespace Instructions {

00041     /// \name Tuple instructions
00042     /// \{

00044     /// Get an element from a Tuple.
00045     /**
00046      * \param Tuple The tuple to pick the element from.
00047      * \param Number The index of the element.
00048      * \return Data The element.
00049      */
00050     void ELT(Machine & machine){
00051         Index element = machine.stack.popNumber();
00052         Tuple  tuple  = machine.stack.popTuple ();
00053         machine.stack.push(tuple[element]);
00054     }
00055     
00056     /// An empty tuple.
00057     /**
00058      * \return Tuple An empty tuple.
00059      */
00060     void NUL_TUP(Machine & machine){
00061         machine.stack.push(Tuple());
00062     }
00063     
00064 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != NO_MIT
00065     /// \deprecated_mitproto{FAB_TUP}
00066     void TUP(Machine & machine){
00067         Index index = machine.nextInt8();
00068         Size elements = machine.nextInt8();
00069         for(Index i = 0; i < elements; i++) machine.globals[index].asTuple()[i] = machine.stack.peek(elements-1-i);
00070         machine.stack.pop(elements);
00071         machine.stack.push(machine.globals[index]);
00072     }
00073 #endif
00074     
00075     /// Create a tuple from one or more elements.
00076     /**
00077      * \param Int8 The number of elements.
00078      * \param Data <tt>[n]</tt> The elements.
00079      * \return Tuple A tuple containing the elements.
00080      */
00081     void FAB_TUP(Machine & machine){
00082         Size elements = machine.nextInt8();
00083         Tuple tuple(elements);
00084         for(Index i = 0; i < elements; i++) tuple.push(machine.stack.peek(elements-i-1));
00085         machine.stack.pop(elements);
00086         machine.stack.push(tuple);
00087     }
00088     
00089     /// Create a tuple filled with one element.
00090     /**
00091      * \param Int8 The number of elements in the resulting tuple.
00092      * \param Data The element to fill the tuple with.
00093      * \return Tuple A tuple filled with the specified element.
00094      */
00095     void FAB_VEC(Machine & machine){
00096         Size elements = machine.nextInt8();
00097         Tuple tuple(elements);
00098         Data element = machine.stack.pop();
00099         for(Index i = 0; i < elements; i++) tuple.push(element);
00100         machine.stack.push(tuple);
00101     }
00102     
00103     /// Create a tuple filled with zero's.
00104     /**
00105      * \param Int8 The number of zero's to put in the tuple.
00106      * \return Tuple A tuple filled with zero's.
00107      */
00108     void FAB_NUM_VEC(Machine & machine){
00109         Size elements = machine.nextInt8();
00110         Tuple tuple(elements);
00111         for(Index i = 0; i < elements; i++) tuple.push(0);
00112         machine.stack.push(tuple);
00113     }
00114     
00115     /// Get the number of elements in a tuple.
00116     /**
00117      * \param Tuple The tuple.
00118      * \return Number The number of elements in the tuple.
00119      */
00120     void LEN(Machine & machine){
00121         machine.stack.push(machine.stack.popTuple().size());
00122     }

00124 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != NO_MIT
00125     /// \deprecated_mitproto{VEC_ADD}
00126     void VADD(Machine & machine){
00127         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00128         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00129         Size min_size = a.size() < b.size() ? a.size() : b.size();
00130         Size max_size = a.size() < b.size() ? b.size() : a.size();
00131         Tuple & largest = a.size() < b.size() ? b : a;
00132         Tuple & result = machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()].asTuple() = Tuple(max_size);
00133         for(Index i = 0       ; i < min_size; i++) result.push(a[i].asNumber() + b[i].asNumber());
00134         for(Index i = min_size; i < max_size; i++) result.push(largest[i].asNumber());
00135         machine.stack.push(result);
00136     }
00137     
00138     /// \deprecated_mitproto{VEC_SUB}
00139     void VSUB(Machine & machine){
00140         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00141         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00142         Size min_size     = a.size() < b.size() ? a.size() : b.size();
00143         Size max_size     = a.size() < b.size() ? b.size() : a.size();
00144         Tuple & largest     = a.size() < b.size() ? b        : a       ;
00145         Number padding_sign = a.size() < b.size() ? -1       : 1       ;
00146         Tuple & result = machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()].asTuple() = Tuple(max_size);
00147         for(Index i = 0       ; i < min_size; i++) result.push(a[i].asNumber() - b[i].asNumber());
00148         for(Index i = min_size; i < max_size; i++) result.push(padding_sign * largest[i].asNumber());
00149         machine.stack.push(result);
00150     }
00151     
00152     /// \deprecated_mitproto{VEC_DOT}
00153     void VDOT(Machine & machine){
00154         Number result = 0;
00155         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00156         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00157         Size min_size = a.size() < b.size() ? a.size() : b.size();
00158         for(Index i = 0; i < min_size; i++) result += a[i].asNumber() * b[i].asNumber();
00159         machine.stack.push(result);
00160     }
00161     
00162     /// \deprecated_mitproto{VEC_MUL}
00163     void VMUL(Machine & machine){
00164         Tuple & result = machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()].asTuple() = Tuple();
00165         Tuple  b = machine.stack.popTuple ();
00166         Number a = machine.stack.popNumber();
00167         for(Index i = 0; i < b.size(); i++) result.push(a * b[i].asNumber());
00168         machine.stack.push(result);
00169     }
00170     
00171     /// \deprecated_mitproto
00172     void VSLICE(Machine & machine){
00173         Tuple & result = machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()].asTuple() = Tuple();
00174         Tuple source = machine.stack.popTuple();
00175         Index start = machine.stack.popNumber();
00176         Index stop  = machine.stack.popNumber();
00177         start = start >= 0 ? start : source.size() + start;
00178         stop  = stop  >= 0 ? stop  : source.size() + stop ;
00179         for(Index i = start; i < stop; i++) result.push(source[i].asNumber());
00180         machine.stack.push(result);
00181     }
00182 #endif
00183     
00184 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00185     /// Element wise addition of two numeric tuples.
00186     /**
00187      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00188      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00189      * 
00190      * \return Tuple The result of an element wise addition.
00191      * 
00192      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00193      */
00194     void VEC_ADD(Machine & machine){
00195         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00196         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00197         Size min_size = a.size() < b.size() ? a.size() : b.size();
00198         Size max_size = a.size() < b.size() ? b.size() : a.size();
00199         Tuple & largest = a.size() < b.size() ? b : a;
00200         Tuple result(max_size);
00201         for(Index i = 0       ; i < min_size; i++) result.push(a[i].asNumber() + b[i].asNumber());
00202         for(Index i = min_size; i < max_size; i++) result.push(largest[i].asNumber());
00203         machine.stack.push(result);
00204     }
00205     
00206     /// Element wise subtraction of two numeric tuples.
00207     /**
00208      * \param Tuple The numeric tuple to substract from.
00209      * \param Tuple The numeric tuple to substract.
00210      * 
00211      * \return Tuple The result of an element wise subtraction.
00212      * 
00213      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00214      */
00215     void VEC_SUB(Machine & machine){
00216         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00217         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00218         Size min_size     = a.size() < b.size() ? a.size() : b.size();
00219         Size max_size     = a.size() < b.size() ? b.size() : a.size();
00220         Tuple & largest     = a.size() < b.size() ? b        : a       ;
00221         Number padding_sign = a.size() < b.size() ? -1       : 1       ;
00222         Tuple result(max_size);
00223         for(Index i = 0       ; i < min_size; i++) result.push(a[i].asNumber() - b[i].asNumber());
00224         for(Index i = min_size; i < max_size; i++) result.push(padding_sign * largest[i].asNumber());
00225         machine.stack.push(result);
00226     }
00227     
00228     /// Dot product of two numeric tuples.
00229     /**
00230      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00231      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00232      * 
00233      * \return Number The result of the dot product.
00234      * 
00235      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00236      */
00237     void VEC_DOT(Machine & machine){
00238         Number result = 0;
00239         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00240         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00241         Size min_size = a.size() < b.size() ? a.size() : b.size();
00242         for(Index i = 0; i < min_size; i++) result += a[i].asNumber() * b[i].asNumber();
00243         machine.stack.push(result);
00244     }
00245     
00246     /// Element wise multiplication of two numeric tuples.
00247     /**
00248      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00249      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00250      * 
00251      * \return Tuple The result of an element wise multiplication.
00252      * 
00253      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00254      */
00255     void VEC_MUL(Machine & machine){
00256         Tuple & result = machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()].asTuple() = Tuple();
00257         Tuple  b = machine.stack.popTuple ();
00258         Number a = machine.stack.popNumber();
00259         for(Index i = 0; i < b.size(); i++) result.push(a * b[i].asNumber());
00260         machine.stack.push(result);
00261     }
00262 #endif
00263     
00264     /// Check if two numeric tuples are equal.
00265     /**
00266      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00267      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00268      * 
00269      * \return Number 1 when the elements in the tuples are equal, 0 otherwise.
00270      * 
00271      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00272      */
00273     void VEQ(Machine & machine){
00274         machine.stack.push(compareVectors(machine) == 0 ? 1 : 0);
00275     }
00276     
00277 #if MIT_COMPATIBILITY != MIT_ONLY
00278     /// Check if two numeric vectors are unequal.
00279     /**
00280      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00281      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00282      * 
00283      * \return Number 0 when the elements in the tuples are equal, 1 otherwise.
00284      * 
00285      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00286      */
00287     void VNEQ(Machine & machine){
00288         machine.stack.push(compareVectors(machine) != 0 ? 1 : 0);
00289     }
00290 #endif
00291     
00292     /// Check if a numeric tuple is (lexicographical) less than another.
00293     /**
00294      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00295      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00296      * 
00297      * \return Number 1 when when the first tuple is lexicographical less than the second, 0 otherwise.
00298      * 
00299      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00300      */
00301     void VLT(Machine & machine){
00302         machine.stack.push(compareVectors(machine) < 0 ? 1 : 0);
00303     }
00304     
00305     /// Check if a numeric tuple is (lexicographical) less than or equal to another.
00306     /**
00307      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00308      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00309      * 
00310      * \return Number 1 when when the first tuple is lexicographical less than or equal to the second, 0 otherwise.
00311      * 
00312      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00313      */
00314     void VLTE(Machine & machine){
00315         machine.stack.push(compareVectors(machine) <= 0 ? 1 : 0);
00316     }
00317     
00318     /// Check if a numeric tuple is (lexicographical) greater than another.
00319     /**
00320      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00321      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00322      * 
00323      * \return Number 1 when when the first tuple is lexicographical greater than the second, 0 otherwise.
00324      * 
00325      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00326      */
00327     void VGT(Machine & machine){
00328         machine.stack.push(compareVectors(machine) > 0 ? 1 : 0);
00329     }
00330     
00331     /// Check if a numeric tuple is (lexicographical) greater than or equal to another.
00332     /**
00333      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00334      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00335      * 
00336      * \return Number 1 when when the first tuple is lexicographical greater than or equal to the second, 0 otherwise.
00337      * 
00338      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00339      */
00340     void VGTE(Machine & machine){
00341         machine.stack.push(compareVectors(machine) >= 0 ? 1 : 0);
00342     }
00343     
00344     /// Pick the (lexicographical) smallest numeric tuple.
00345     /**
00346      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00347      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00348      * 
00349      * \return Tuple The first tuple when when that tuple is lexicographical less than or equal to the other, the second one otherwise.
00350      * 
00351      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00352      */
00353     void VMIN(Machine & machine){
00354         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00355         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00356         machine.stack.push(compareVectors(a,b) <= 0 ? a : b);
00357     }
00358     
00359     /// Pick the (lexicographical) biggest numeric tuple.
00360     /**
00361      * \param Tuple The first numeric tuple.
00362      * \param Tuple The second numeric tuple.
00363      * 
00364      * \return Tuple The first tuple when when that tuple is lexicographical greater than or equal to the other, the second one otherwise.
00365      * 
00366      * If one of the tuples is shorter, the remaining of the elements will be interpreted as 0.
00367      */
00368     void VMAX(Machine & machine){
00369         Tuple b = machine.stack.popTuple();
00370         Tuple a = machine.stack.popTuple();
00371         machine.stack.push(compareVectors(a,b) >= 0 ? a : b);
00372     }
